section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date")
explanation: The agreement states it's entered into on October 1, 2019, but made effective on November 1, 2019. This means the terms of the agreement don't apply for the month of October, leaving potential ambiguity as to actions or services performed during this gap and whether they are governed by this agreement.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The phrase 'This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement' is structurally flawed in text because it does not use the correct legal phrasing. In order to correct this, it would need to read 'This agreement will be effective as of the Effective Date.

section: Upon termination of this Agreement in its entirety pursuant to Section 3.1, all obligations of the Parties hereto shall terminate, except for the provisions of Section 2.2, and the entirety of Sections 4, 5 and 6, which shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.
explanation: Section 2.2 addresses 'Terms of Payment and Related Matters,' this section surviving termination conflicts with the general termination clause in Section 3.1. It's unclear if payments are only for services already rendered or if there are other payment obligations post-termination.
